locals {
  aws_environment      = "stg"
  aws_vpc_environment  = "stg"
  region               = data.aws_region.current.name
  name                 = "msk-serverless-${local.aws_environment}"
  aws_account_ids      = [data.aws_caller_identity.current.account_id, local.omfcardsstg_account_id]
  aws_vpc_id           = data.aws_vpc.current.id
  private_subnet_ids   = data.aws_subnets.private.ids
  msk_arn_prefix       = join(":", slice(split(":", module.msk_cluster.arn), 0, 5))

  omfcardsstg_account_id = "636519986403"

  tags = {
    Name        = local.name
    Environment = local.aws_environment
  }

  private_subnet_cidrs = values(data.aws_subnet.private).*.cidr_block
  allowed_ext_cidrs    = [
    data.terraform_remote_state.cards_vpc.outputs.vpc_cidr_block,
    data.terraform_remote_state.eds_vpc.outputs.vpc_cidr_block,
    local.jenkins_vpc_cidr
  ]
  sg_allowed_cidrs = concat(local.private_subnet_cidrs, local.allowed_ext_cidrs)
  jenkins_vpc_cidr = "10.26.0.0/16"
}

module "catalyst_document_file_upload_lambda" {
  source = "../../../../../modules/plos/lambda"

  # Required variables
  project_name               = lower(local.product)
  function_name              = local.function_name
  src                        = "${path.module}/src/document-file-upload"
  location                   = local.aws_region
  handler                    = "src/${local.app_name}-lambda.handler"
  lambda_security_group_name = "${local.function_name}-sg"
  cloud_watch_log_group      = "/aws/lambda/${local.function_name}"
  env_vars                   = local.shared_sensitive_env_variables

  # Configuration
  runtime             = "nodejs22.x"
  function_timeout    = 300
  lambda_architecture = "x86_64"
  deployment_file     = "${local.app_name}.zip"
  zip_file_name       = "${local.app_name}.zip"

  # VPC Configuration
  vpc_id     = data.terraform_remote_state.cluster_vpc.outputs.vpc_id
  subnet_ids = data.terraform_remote_state.cluster_vpc.outputs.private_subnets

  # Security and Logging
  create_security_group        = true
  create_cloud_watch_log_group = true

  # Egress rules for AWS service access
  egress_rules = [
    {
      from_port       = 443
      to_port         = 443
      protocol        = "tcp"
      cidr_blocks     = ["0.0.0.0/0"]
      security_groups = []
    }
  ]
}

module "security_group" {
  source  = "terraform-aws-modules/security-group/aws"
  version = "~> 5.0"

  name        = local.name
  description = "Security group for ${local.name}"
  vpc_id      = data.aws_vpc.current.id


  ingress_cidr_blocks = local.sg_allowed_cidrs
  ingress_rules = [
    "kafka-broker-tcp",
    "kafka-broker-tls-tcp",
    "kafka-broker-sasl-iam-tcp"
  ]

  tags = local.tags
}


module "msk_cluster" {
  source = "git@github.com:omfterraform/terraform-aws-msk-serverless.git?ref=v1.1.1"

  cluster_name                    = local.name
  subnet_ids                      = local.private_subnet_ids
  security_group_ids              = [module.security_group.security_group_id]
  create_s3_plugin                = 1
  aws_account_ids                 = local.aws_account_ids
  vpc_id                          = data.aws_vpc.current.id

  allow_assume = [
    "arn:aws:iam::960049795234:root",
    "arn:aws:iam::523572232308:root",
    "arn:aws:iam::960049795234:role/omf-cards-id-verification-service--development-eks",
    "arn:aws:iam::014524682603:role/odop-cf-prod-jenkins-ue1-all-AgentIAMRole-1PFGKAX2ZB9FR",
    "arn:aws:iam::014524682603:role/odop-cf-prod-jenkins-ue1-all-MasterIAMRole-1VC99UC1OXJJZ"
  ]

  tags = local.tags
}

module "nlb_setup" {
  source             = "git@github.com:omfterraform/terraform-aws-msk-nlb.git?ref=v1.0.0"
  lb_name            = "oshd-ec2-dev-msk-nlb-ue1-all"
  security_groups    = [module.security_group.security_group_id]
  subnets            = local.private_subnet_ids
  vpc_id             = data.aws_vpc.current.id
  internal           = true
  tags               = {}
  vpce_ips           = data.dns_a_record_set.vpce.addrs
  depends_on         = [ data.dns_a_record_set.vpce ]
}

data "aws_vpc_endpoint" "msk" {
  vpc_id = data.aws_vpc.current.id
  tags = {
    ClusterArn	  = module.msk_cluster.arn
    AWSMSKManaged = "true"
  }
  depends_on = [ module.msk_cluster ]
}

data "dns_a_record_set" "vpce" {
  host = data.aws_vpc_endpoint.msk.dns_entry[0].dns_name
  depends_on = [ data.aws_vpc_endpoint.msk ]
}

locals {
  aws_environment      = "dev"
  aws_vpc_environment  = "development"
  region               = data.aws_region.current.name
  name                 = "msk-serverless-${local.aws_environment}"
  aws_account_ids      = [data.aws_caller_identity.current.account_id, local.omfcardsdev_account_id, local.devops_prod_account_id]
  aws_vpc_id           = data.aws_vpc.current.id
  private_subnet_ids   = data.aws_subnets.private.ids
  msk_arn_prefix       = join(":", slice(split(":", module.msk_cluster.arn), 0, 5))

  omfcardsdev_account_id = "960049795234"
  devops_prod_account_id = "014524682603"

  tags = {
    Name        = local.name
    Environment = local.aws_environment
  }

  private_subnet_cidrs = values(data.aws_subnet.private).*.cidr_block
  allowed_ext_cidrs    = [
    data.terraform_remote_state.cards_vpc.outputs.vpc_cidr_block,
    data.terraform_remote_state.eds_vpc.outputs.vpc_cidr_block,
    local.jenkins_vpc_cidr
  ]
  sg_allowed_cidrs = concat(local.private_subnet_cidrs, local.allowed_ext_cidrs)
  jenkins_vpc_cidr = "10.26.0.0/16"
}

module "catalyst_document_file_upload_lambda" {
  source = "../../../../../modules/plos/lambda"

  # Required variables
  project_name               = lower(local.product)
  function_name              = local.function_name
  src                        = "${path.module}/src/document-file-upload"
  location                   = local.aws_region
  handler                    = "src/${local.app_name}-lambda.handler"
  lambda_security_group_name = "${local.function_name}-sg"
  cloud_watch_log_group      = "/aws/lambda/${local.function_name}"
  env_vars                   = local.shared_sensitive_env_variables

  # Configuration
  runtime             = "nodejs22.x"
  function_timeout    = 300
  lambda_architecture = "x86_64"
  deployment_file     = "${local.app_name}.zip"
  zip_file_name       = "${local.app_name}.zip"

  # VPC Configuration
  vpc_id     = data.terraform_remote_state.cluster_vpc.outputs.vpc_id
  subnet_ids = data.terraform_remote_state.cluster_vpc.outputs.private_subnets

  # Security and Logging
  create_security_group        = true
  create_cloud_watch_log_group = true

  # Egress rules for AWS service access
  egress_rules = [
    {
      from_port       = 443
      to_port         = 443
      protocol        = "tcp"
      cidr_blocks     = ["0.0.0.0/0"]
      security_groups = []
    },
    {
      from_port       = 9098
      to_port         = 9098
      protocol        = "tcp"
      cidr_blocks     = ["10.0.0.0/8"]
      security_groups = []
    }
  ]
}

# MSK Event Source Mapping with IAM Authentication
resource "aws_lambda_event_source_mapping" "msk_trigger" {
  event_source_arn          = data.terraform_remote_state.msk_cluster.outputs.arn
  function_name             = module.catalyst_document_file_upload_lambda.function_name
  topics                    = ["document-file-upload-topic"]
  starting_position         = "LATEST"
  batch_size                = 10
  maximum_batching_window_in_seconds = 5

  # Amazon MSK configuration for IAM authentication
  amazon_managed_kafka_event_source_config {
    consumer_group_id = "catalyst-document-file-upload-consumer"
  }

  # Source access configuration for IAM authentication
  source_access_configuration {
    type = "MSK_SERVERLESS_DEFAULT_IAM_ROLE_FOR_LAMBDA"
    uri  = ""
  }

  depends_on = [
    module.catalyst_document_file_upload_lambda

module "catalyst_document_file_upload_lambda" {
  source = "../../../../../modules/plos/lambda"

  # Required variables
  project_name               = lower(local.product)
  function_name              = local.function_name
  src                        = "${path.module}/src/document-file-upload"
  location                   = local.aws_region
  handler                    = "src/${local.app_name}-lambda.handler"
  lambda_security_group_name = "${local.function_name}-sg"
  cloud_watch_log_group      = "/aws/lambda/${local.function_name}"
  env_vars                   = local.shared_sensitive_env_variables

  # Configuration
  runtime             = "nodejs22.x"
  function_timeout    = 300
  lambda_architecture = "x86_64"
  deployment_file     = "${local.app_name}.zip"
  zip_file_name       = "${local.app_name}.zip"

  # VPC Configuration
  vpc_id     = data.terraform_remote_state.cluster_vpc.outputs.vpc_id
  subnet_ids = data.terraform_remote_state.cluster_vpc.outputs.private_subnets

  # Security and Logging
  create_security_group        = true
  create_cloud_watch_log_group = true

  # Egress rules for AWS service access
  egress_rules = [
    {
      from_port       = 443
      to_port         = 443
      protocol        = "tcp"
      cidr_blocks     = ["0.0.0.0/0"]
      security_groups = []
    },
    {
      from_port       = 9098
      to_port         = 9098
      protocol        = "tcp"
      cidr_blocks     = ["10.0.0.0/8"]
      security_groups = []
    }
  ]
}

# MSK Event Source Mapping with IAM Authentication
resource "aws_lambda_event_source_mapping" "msk_trigger" {
  event_source_arn          = data.terraform_remote_state.msk_cluster.outputs.arn
  function_name             = module.catalyst_document_file_upload_lambda.function_name
  topics                    = ["document-file-upload-topic"]
  starting_position         = "LATEST"
  batch_size                = 10
  maximum_batching_window_in_seconds = 5

  # Amazon MSK configuration for IAM authentication
  amazon_managed_kafka_event_source_config {
    consumer_group_id = "catalyst-document-file-upload-consumer"
  }

  depends_on = [
    module.catalyst_document_file_upload_lambda,
    aws_iam_role_policy_attachment.msk_lambda_policy
  ]
}

# IAM policy for MSK access
resource "aws_iam_policy" "msk_lambda_policy" {
  name        = "${local.function_name}-msk-policy"
  description = "IAM policy for Lambda to access MSK with IAM authentication"
  
  policy = jsonencode({
    Version = "2012-10-17"
    Statement = [
      {
        Effect = "Allow"
        Action = [
          "kafka-cluster:Connect",
          "kafka-cluster:DescribeCluster"
        ]
        Resource = [
          data.terraform_remote_state.msk_cluster.outputs.arn
        ]
      },
      {
        Effect = "Allow"
        Action = [
          "kafka-cluster:*Topic*",
          "kafka-cluster:WriteData",
          "kafka-cluster:ReadData"
        ]
        Resource = [
          "${data.terraform_remote_state.msk_cluster.outputs.arn}/topic/*"
        ]
      },
      {
        Effect = "Allow"
        Action = [
          "kafka-cluster:AlterGroup",
          "kafka-cluster:DescribeGroup"
        ]
        Resource = [
          "${data.terraform_remote_state.msk_cluster.outputs.arn}/group/*"
        ]
      }
    ]
  })
}

# Attach MSK policy to Lambda role
resource "aws_iam_role_policy_attachment" "msk_lambda_policy" {
  role       = module.catalyst_document_file_upload_lambda.iam_role_name
  policy_arn = aws_iam_policy.msk_lambda_policy.arn
}

module "catalyst_document_file_upload_lambda" {
  source = "../../../../../modules/plos/lambda"

  # Required variables
  project_name               = lower(local.product)
  function_name              = local.function_name
  src                        = "${path.module}/src/document-file-upload"
  location                   = local.aws_region
  handler                    = "src/${local.app_name}-lambda.handler"
  lambda_security_group_name = "${local.function_name}-sg"
  cloud_watch_log_group      = "/aws/lambda/${local.function_name}"
  env_vars                   = local.shared_sensitive_env_variables

  # Configuration
  runtime             = "nodejs22.x"
  function_timeout    = 300
  lambda_architecture = "x86_64"
  deployment_file     = "${local.app_name}.zip"
  zip_file_name       = "${local.app_name}.zip"

  # VPC Configuration
  vpc_id     = data.terraform_remote_state.cluster_vpc.outputs.vpc_id
  subnet_ids = data.terraform_remote_state.cluster_vpc.outputs.private_subnets

  # Security and Logging
  create_security_group        = true
  create_cloud_watch_log_group = true

  # Egress rules for AWS service access
  egress_rules = [
    {
      from_port       = 443
      to_port         = 443
      protocol        = "tcp"
      cidr_blocks     = ["0.0.0.0/0"]
      security_groups = []
    },
    {
      from_port       = 9098
      to_port         = 9098
      protocol        = "tcp"
      cidr_blocks     = ["10.0.0.0/8"]
      security_groups = []
    }
  ]
}

# MSK Event Source Mapping with IAM Authentication
resource "aws_lambda_event_source_mapping" "msk_trigger" {
  event_source_arn                   = data.terraform_remote_state.msk_cluster.outputs.arn
  function_name                      = module.catalyst_document_file_upload_lambda.function_name
  topics                             = ["document-file-upload-topic"]
  starting_position                  = "LATEST"
  batch_size                         = 10
  maximum_batching_window_in_seconds = 5

  # Amazon MSK configuration for IAM authentication
  amazon_managed_kafka_event_source_config {
    consumer_group_id = "catalyst-document-file-upload-consumer"
  }

  depends_on = [
    module.catalyst_document_file_upload_lambda,
    aws_iam_role_policy_attachment.msk_lambda_policy
  ]
}

# IAM policy for MSK access
resource "aws_iam_policy" "msk_lambda_policy" {
  name        = "${local.function_name}-msk-policy"
  description = "IAM policy for Lambda to access MSK with IAM authentication"

  policy = jsonencode({
    Version = "2012-10-17"
    Statement = [
      {
        Effect = "Allow"
        Action = [
          "kafka-cluster:Connect",
          "kafka-cluster:DescribeCluster"
        ]
        Resource = [
          data.terraform_remote_state.msk_cluster.outputs.msk_serverless_cluster_arn
        ]
      },
      {
        Effect = "Allow"
        Action = [
          "kafka-cluster:*Topic*",
          "kafka-cluster:WriteData",
          "kafka-cluster:ReadData"
        ]
        Resource = [
          "${data.terraform_remote_state.msk_cluster.outputs.msk_serverless_cluster_arn}/topic/*"
        ]
      },
      {
        Effect = "Allow"
        Action = [
          "kafka-cluster:AlterGroup",
          "kafka-cluster:DescribeGroup"
        ]
        Resource = [
          "${data.terraform_remote_state.msk_cluster.outputs.msk_serverless_cluster_arn}/group/*"
        ]
      }
    ]
  })
}

# Attach MSK policy to Lambda role
resource "aws_iam_role_policy_attachment" "msk_lambda_policy" {
  role       = module.catalyst_document_file_upload_lambda.lambda_role_name
  policy_arn = aws_iam_policy.msk_lambda_policy.arn
}

# IAM policy for MSK access
resource "aws_iam_policy" "msk_lambda_policy" {
  name        = "${local.function_name}-msk-policy"
  description = "IAM policy for Lambda to access MSK with IAM authentication"

  policy = jsonencode({
    Version = "2012-10-17"
    Statement = [
      {
        Effect = "Allow"
        Action = [
          "kafka-cluster:Connect",
          "kafka-cluster:DescribeCluster"
        ]
        Resource = [
          data.terraform_remote_state.msk_cluster.outputs.msk_serverless_cluster_arn
        ]
      },
      {
        Effect = "Allow"
        Action = [
          "kafka-cluster:*Topic*",
          "kafka-cluster:WriteData",
          "kafka-cluster:ReadData"
        ]
        Resource = [
          "${data.terraform_remote_state.msk_cluster.outputs.msk_serverless_cluster_arn}/topic/*"
        ]
      },
      {
        Effect = "Allow"
        Action = [
          "kafka-cluster:AlterGroup",
          "kafka-cluster:DescribeGroup"
        ]
        Resource = [
          "${data.terraform_remote_state.msk_cluster.outputs.msk_serverless_cluster_arn}/group/*"
        ]
      }
    ]
  })
}

# Attach MSK policy to Lambda role
resource "aws_iam_role_policy_attachment" "msk_lambda_policy" {
  role       = module.catalyst_document_file_upload_lambda.lambda_role_name
  policy_arn = aws_iam_policy.msk_lambda_policy.arn
}

content.text:
Line 53 `starting_position = "LATEST"` tells the Lambda event source mapping where to start reading messages from the Kafka topic when it first connects.

**Options:**
- `LATEST` - Start reading from the newest messages (skip all existing messages)  
- `TRIM_HORIZON` - Start reading from the oldest available messages

This means when the Lambda first subscribes to the topic, it will only process new messages that arrive after the subscription is created, ignoring any messages that were already in the topic.

message.content:
why do we need this egress?
@/Users/a.agrawal/work/omfsvcshub/infrastructure/terraform/aws/omfsvcshubdev/us-east-1/plos/develop/catalyst-document-file-upload-lambda/main.tf:38-45

content.text:
The egress rule for port 9098 allows the Lambda to communicate with the MSK cluster:

```terraform
{
  from_port       = 9098
  to_port         = 9098
  protocol        = "tcp"
  cidr_blocks     = ["10.0.0.0/8"]
  security_groups = []
}
```

**Port 9098** is the standard port for MSK Serverless with IAM authentication. The Lambda needs outbound access to this port to:

1. Connect to the MSK cluster
2. Authenticate using IAM credentials  
3. Read messages from the Kafka topic
4. Send consumer group coordination messages

**CIDR `10.0.0.0/8`** allows access to the private network range where the MSK cluster endpoints are located within the VPC.

Without this egress rule, the Lambda would be blocked from connecting to MSK and the event source mapping would fail.

content.content:
Here's a comprehensive summary of the GitHub Slack integration README, formatted for Confluence:

h1. GitHub Integration for Slack

h2. Overview

The GitHub integration for Slack enables teams to:
- Receive GitHub notifications directly in Slack channels
- Collaborate on GitHub projects without leaving Slack
- Customize notification settings
- Take actions on issues and pull requests

h2. Installation Requirements

h3. Supported Platforms
- GitHub.com (GitHub Enterprise Cloud)
- GitHub Enterprise Cloud with data residency
- GitHub Enterprise Server (GHES 3.8+)

h3. Installation Steps
# [Install the GitHub integration for Slack](https://slack.com/apps/A01BP7R4KNY-github)
# Sign in to your Slack workspace
# Grant required permissions
# Add the GitHub integration to relevant channels using `/invite @github`

h2. Key Features

h3. Notification Customization
- Subscribe to specific repositories or organizations
- Filter notifications by:
    * Issues
    * Pull requests
    * Commits
    * Workflows
    * Deployments
    * Labels

h3. Workflow Notifications
- Track GitHub Actions workflow runs
- Approve workflows directly from Slack
- Filter notifications by:
    * Workflow name
    * Event type
    * Branch
    * Actor

h3. Collaboration Capabilities
- Create issues from Slack messages
- Manage issue lifecycle in chat
- Mention team members in notifications
- Thread conversations for context

h2. Configuration Commands

h3. Subscription Management
- Subscribe: `/github subscribe owner/repo [feature]`
- Unsubscribe: `/github unsubscribe owner/repo [feature]`

h3. Notification Filters
- Branch filters: `/github subscribe org/repo commits:branchname`
- Label filters: `/github subscribe org/repo +label:"priority:HIGH"`

h2. Permissions

The integration requires permissions for:
- Slack: 
    * Access conversations
    * Add slash commands
    * Post messages
- GitHub:
    * Read repository metadata
    * Write access to issues and pull requests

h2. Best Practices
- Connect GitHub account to enable mentions
- Use threading to reduce channel noise
- Customize

content.text:
Based on the GitHub Slack integration README, here's a comprehensive Confluence article:

# GitHub Slack Integration - Setup and Configuration Guide

## Overview

The GitHub integration for Slack enables seamless collaboration between development teams by bringing GitHub notifications and workflows directly into Slack channels. This integration allows teams to stay updated on repository activities, manage issues and pull requests, and collaborate on code without leaving their communication platform.

### Key Benefits
- Real-time GitHub notifications in Slack channels
- Reduced context switching between tools
- Enhanced team collaboration on code reviews
- Streamlined issue and pull request management
- Workflow automation and approval capabilities

---

## Prerequisites and Requirements

### Supported Platforms
- **GitHub.com** (GitHub Enterprise Cloud)
- **GitHub Enterprise Cloud** with data residency
- **GitHub Enterprise Server** (version 3.8 and later)

### Required Permissions

**Slack Workspace:**
- Admin permissions to install integrations
- Channel management permissions for target channels

**GitHub Account:**
- Repository access (read/write depending on use case)
- Organization member permissions (for organization repos)

---

## Installation Process

### Step 1: Install the Integration
1. Navigate to the [GitHub Slack Integration](https://slack.com/apps/A01BP7R4KNY-github) in the Slack App Directory
2. Click **"Add to Slack"**
3. Sign in to your Slack workspace if prompted
4. Review and grant the required permissions:
   - Access conversations and channels
   - Add slash commands and shortcuts  
   - Post messages and attachments
   - View basic information about public channels

### Step 2: Connect GitHub Account
1. In any Slack channel, type `/github signin`
2. Click the generated link to authenticate with GitHub
3. Authorize the Slack integration to access your GitHub account
4. Grant necessary repository permissions

### Step 3: Add Integration to Channels
1. Navigate to the channel where you want GitHub notifications
2. Type `/invite @github` to add the GitHub bot
3. Repeat for all relevant channels

---

## Configuration Options

### Repository Subscriptions

**Basic Subscription:**
```
/github subscribe owner/repository-name
```

**Subscribe with Specific Features:**
```
/github subscribe owner/repo issues,pulls,commits,releases
```

**Available Features:**
- `issues` - Issue creation, updates, and closures
- `pulls` - Pull request activities
- `commits` - Commit notifications  
- `releases` - Release announcements
- `deployments` - Deployment status updates
- `workflows` - GitHub Actions workflow results

### Advanced Filtering

**Branch-Specific Notifications:**
```
/github subscribe owner/repo commits:main
/github subscribe owner/repo pulls:develop
```

**Label-Based Filtering:**
```
/github subscribe owner/repo issues +label:"bug"
/github subscribe owner/repo pulls +label:"ready-for-review"
```

**Exclude Specific Labels:**
```
/github subscribe owner/repo issues -label:"wontfix"
```

### Workflow Notifications

**Subscribe to All Workflows:**
```
/github subscribe owner/repo workflows
```

**Filter by Workflow Name:**
```
/github subscribe owner/repo workflows:deployment
```

**Filter by Event Type:**
```
/github subscribe owner/repo workflows:{event:'pull_request'}
```

---

## Notification Customization

### Threading Options
- **Enable Threading:** `/github subscribe owner/repo workflows +threads`
- **Disable Threading:** `/github subscribe owner/repo workflows -threads`

### Notification Scheduling
Configure quiet hours and notification schedules:
```
/github settings notifications schedule weekdays 9-17
```

### Channel-Specific Settings
Each channel can have different subscription settings:
- Development channels: commits, pulls, workflows
- Management channels: releases, critical issues only
- QA channels: deployments, workflow failures

---

## Collaboration Features

### Creating Issues from Slack
1. Right-click on any Slack message
2. Select **"More actions"**  **"Create GitHub Issue"**
3. Choose repository and fill in issue details
4. Issue link will be posted back to the channel

### Managing Pull Requests
- **Approve PR:** Click approve button in notification
- **Request Changes:** Use the request changes option
- **Merge:** Available for authorized users

### Mentions and Notifications
- GitHub usernames automatically convert to Slack mentions
- Team notifications respect GitHub team membership
- Custom mention mapping available via settings

---

## Management Commands

### Viewing Subscriptions
```
/github subscribe list
```

### Unsubscribing
```
/github unsubscribe owner/repository-name
/github unsubscribe owner/repo feature-name
```

### Account Management
```
/github signin          # Connect GitHub account
/github signout         # Disconnect GitHub account  
/github settings        # View current settings
```

---

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues

**Integration Not Responding**
- Verify the GitHub bot is added to the channel (`/invite @github`)
- Check if GitHub account is properly connected (`/github signin`)
- Ensure repository permissions are granted

**Missing Notifications**
- Confirm subscription is active (`/github subscribe list`)
- Check GitHub repository webhook settings
- Verify Slack notification preferences
- Review any applied filters that might exclude notifications

**Permission Errors**
- Ensure GitHub account has proper repository access
- Check organization permissions for private repositories
- Verify Slack workspace admin has approved the integration

**Workflow Notifications Not Working**
- Confirm GitHub Actions are enabled on the repository
- Check workflow file syntax and triggers
- Verify subscription includes workflows feature
- Review workflow permissions in repository settings

### Getting Help

**Within Slack:**
```
/github help            # Display available commands
/github feedback        # Submit feedback or issues
```

**External Resources:**
- [GitHub Community Discussions](https://github.com/community/community/discussions)
- [Slack Support Documentation](https://slack.com/help)
- Repository maintainer contact information

### Logs and Debugging
- Use `/github subscribe list` to verify active subscriptions
- Check Slack audit logs for integration activities
- Review GitHub webhook delivery logs in repository settings
- Monitor GitHub Actions logs for workflow-related issues

---

## Best Practices

### Channel Organization
- **#engineering-notifications:** All commits, PRs, and workflow results
- **#releases:** Major releases and deployment notifications
- **#critical-issues:** High-priority bugs and security issues only
- **#code-reviews:** Pull request notifications with threading enabled

### Notification Management
- Start with minimal subscriptions and add features as needed
- Use threading to reduce channel noise
- Implement branch filters for focused notifications
- Regular review and cleanup of subscriptions

### Security Considerations
- Regularly audit integration permissions
- Use organization-level controls where possible
- Monitor webhook delivery logs for unusual activity
- Ensure team members connect individual GitHub accounts

### Performance Optimization
- Avoid over-subscribing to high-traffic repositories
- Use specific branch and label filters
- Consider separate channels for different notification types
- Implement quiet hours for non-critical notifications

---

```markdown
# GitHub Slack Integration - Setup and Configuration Guide

## Overview

The GitHub integration for Slack enables seamless collaboration between development teams by bringing GitHub notifications and workflows directly into Slack channels. This integration allows teams to stay updated on repository activities, manage issues and pull requests, and collaborate on code without leaving their communication platform.

### Key Benefits
- Real-time GitHub notifications in Slack channels
- Reduced context switching between tools
- Enhanced team collaboration on code reviews
- Streamlined issue and pull request management
- Workflow automation and approval capabilities

---

## Prerequisites and Requirements

### Supported Platforms
- **GitHub.com** (GitHub Enterprise Cloud)
- **GitHub Enterprise Cloud** with data residency
- **GitHub Enterprise Server** (version 3.8 and later)

### Required Permissions

**Slack Workspace:**
- Admin permissions to install integrations
- Channel management permissions for target channels

**GitHub Account:**
- Repository access (read/write depending on use case)
- Organization member permissions (for organization repos)

---

## Installation Process

### Step 1: Install the Integration
1. Navigate to the [GitHub Slack Integration](https://slack.com/apps/A01BP7R4KNY-github) in the Slack App Directory
2. Click **"Add to Slack"**
3. Sign in to your Slack workspace if prompted
4. Review and grant the required permissions:
   - Access conversations and channels
   - Add slash commands and shortcuts  
   - Post messages and attachments
   - View basic information about public channels

### Step 2: Connect GitHub Account
1. In any Slack channel, type `/github signin`
2. Click the generated link to authenticate with GitHub
3. Authorize the Slack integration to access your GitHub account
4. Grant necessary repository permissions

### Step 3: Add Integration to Channels
1. Navigate to the channel where you want GitHub notifications
2. Type `/invite @github` to add the GitHub bot
3. Repeat for all relevant channels

---

## Configuration Options

### Repository Subscriptions

**Basic Subscription:**
```
/github subscribe owner/repository-name
```

**Subscribe with Specific Features:**
```

```
- `workflows` - GitHub Actions workflow results

### Advanced Filtering
```

/github subscribe owner/repo pulls:develop
```

**Label-Based Filtering:**
```

```
**Exclude Specific Labels:**
```

/github subscribe owner/repo workflows

```
**Filter by Workflow Name:**
```
/github subscribe owner/repo workflows:deployment
```

**Filter by Event Type:**
```
/github subscribe owner/repo workflows:{event:'pull_request'}
```

---

## Notification Customization

### Threading Options
- **Enable Threading:** `/github subscribe owner/repo workflows +threads`
- **Disable Threading:** `/github subscribe owner/repo workflows -threads`

### Notification Scheduling
Configure quiet hours and notification schedules:
```
/github settings notifications schedule weekdays 9-17
```

### Channel-Specific Settings
Each channel can have different subscription settings:
- Development channels: commits, pulls, workflows
- Management channels: releases, critical issues only
- QA channels: deployments, workflow failures

---

## Collaboration Features

### Creating Issues from Slack
1. Right-click on any Slack message
2. Select **"More actions"**  **"Create GitHub Issue"**

- Team notifications respect GitHub team membership
- Custom mention mapping available via settings

---

## Management Commands

### Viewing Subscriptions
```
/github subscribe list
```

### Unsubscribing
```
/github unsubscribe owner/repository-name
/github unsubscribe owner/repo feature-name
```

### Account Management
```
/github signin          # Connect GitHub account
/github signout         # Disconnect GitHub account  
/github settings        # View current settings
```

---

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues

**Integration Not Responding**
- Verify the GitHub bot is added to the channel (`/invite @github`)
- Check if GitHub account is properly connected (`/github signin`)
- Ensure repository permissions are granted

**Missing Notifications**
- Confirm subscription is active (`/github subscribe list`)
- Check GitHub repository webhook settings
- Verify Slack notification preferences
- Review any applied filters that might exclude notifications

**Permission Errors**
- Ensure GitHub account has proper repository access
- Check organization permissions for private repositories
- Verify Slack workspace admin has approved the integration

**Workflow Notifications Not Working**
- Confirm GitHub Actions are enabled on the repository
- Check workflow file syntax and triggers
- Verify subscription includes workflows feature
- Review workflow permissions in repository settings

### Getting Help

**Within Slack:**

```

```
**External Resources:**

### Logs and Debugging
- Use `/github subscribe list` to verify active subscriptions
- Check Slack audit logs for integration activities
- Review GitHub webhook delivery logs in repository settings
- Monitor GitHub Actions logs for workflow-related issues

---

## Best Practices

### Channel Organization
- **#engineering-notifications:** All commits, PRs, and workflow results
- **#releases:** Major releases and deployment notifications
- **#critical-issues:** High-priority bugs and security issues only
- **#code-reviews:** Pull request notifications with threading enabled
```

message.content: I need Jira ticket details in BDD style. The requirment is to create alarms for all the metrics tracked by a dashboard (linked) in grafana, as well as for sustained CPU high usage and JVM pressure over 80% for a long period of time.

content.text:
Here's a Jira ticket in BDD (Behavior-Driven Development) style for creating alarms based on Grafana dashboard metrics:

---

## **Epic/Story Title:**
**Create Comprehensive Monitoring Alarms for Grafana Dashboard Metrics and System Health**

## **Story Description:**
As a DevOps engineer, I want to create automated alarms for all metrics tracked in our Grafana dashboard, including sustained high CPU usage and JVM pressure, so that we can proactively respond to system performance issues before they impact users.

---

## **Acceptance Criteria (BDD Format):**

### **Feature: Dashboard Metrics Alarming**

**Scenario 1: Create alarms for all Grafana dashboard metrics**
```gherkin
Given I have access to the Grafana dashboard with tracked metrics
When I review all the metrics displayed on the dashboard
Then I should create corresponding alarms for each metric
And each alarm should have appropriate thresholds based on historical data
And each alarm should have clear naming conventions following our standards
```

**Scenario 2: Configure CPU usage alarms**
```gherkin
Given the system is monitoring CPU usage metrics
When CPU usage exceeds 80% for more than 10 minutes
Then an alert should be triggered
And the alert should be sent to the on-call team
And the alert should include the affected instance/service details
```

**Scenario 3: Configure JVM pressure alarms**
```gherkin
Given the system is monitoring JVM heap/memory pressure
When JVM pressure exceeds 80% for more than 15 minutes
Then a critical alert should be triggered
And the alert should include JVM metrics details (heap usage, GC frequency)
And the alert should escalate if pressure remains above 90% for 5+ minutes
```

**Scenario 4: Alarm notification routing**
```gherkin
Given alarms are configured for dashboard metrics
When any alarm threshold is breached
Then notifications should be sent to the appropriate channels
And notifications should include metric values and trend information
And notifications should provide links to relevant Grafana dashboards
```

**Scenario 5: Alarm severity classification**
```gherkin
Given different types of metrics have different business impact
When configuring alarms
Then CPU alarms should be classified as "High" severity
And JVM pressure alarms should be classified as "Critical" severity
And other dashboard metric alarms should be classified based on business impact
And each severity level should have appropriate escalation procedures
```

---

## **Technical Requirements:**

### **Given/When/Then for Implementation:**

**Scenario 6: Alarm threshold configuration**
```gherkin
Given I need to set appropriate alarm thresholds
When configuring each alarm
Then CPU alarms should trigger at 80% for 10+ minutes
```
